required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Skin Cancer Prevention With Nicotinamide in Transplant Recipients - Pilot Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Nicotinamide Chemoprevention for Keratinocyte Carcinoma in Solid Organ Transplant Recipients: A Pilot, Placebo-controlled, Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A common long-term side effect of anti-rejection (immunosuppressant) medications is skin cancer. This pilot clinical trial evaluates the feasibility of conducting a larger pivotal trial to examine the efficacy and safety of nicotinamide for prevention of keratinocyte carcinoma in solid organ transplant recipients. This pilot trial will transition into the pivotal trial if all feasibility targets are met.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who consent to data linkage to provincial administrative databases

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility (pertaining to appropriateness of eligibility criteria)
primary_outcome.description: Reasons for exclusion of screened patients
Proportion of capsules returned, reasons for non-adherence

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility (pertaining to adherence to follow-up assessments)
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of missed assessments and incomplete questionnaire data variables, proportion of patients who withdraw from the trial, patient perception of trial participation
Proportion of patients who consent to data linkage to provincial administrative databases

primary_outcome.measure: Preliminary pooled keratinocyte carcinoma event rate
primary_outcome.description: Pooled keratinocyte carcinoma event rate to be used for sample size re-estimation in the pivotal trial.

Proportion of patients with a clinically relevant increase in cyclosporine or tacrolimus blood concentration at 1 week. An increased level will be classified as clinically relevant if the transplant physician reduces the immunosuppressant dose in response to the increased drug level.

Proportion of patients with a clinically relevant increase in cyclosporine or tacrolimus blood concentration at 2 weeks. This measurement will be dropped if all cases of clinically relevant drug interactions manifest at 1 week in the first 20 enrolled participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of recruiting for neurocognitive substudy
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of enrolled participants who consent to participate in the neurocognitive substudy
Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score <26, scored out of 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of MoCA test scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), raw scores are scored out of 30, with a higher score representing better cognitive function

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - Revised scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - Revised, a memory test scored out of 60, with a higher score representing better memory

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of Trail Making A and B test scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Trail Making A and B, a visual attention test. This records the time (in seconds) to completion, with a faster time representing better cognitive function

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of Controlled Oral Word Association test scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Controlled Oral Word Association, a verbal fluency test, measures the production of words belonging to the same letter. This records total number of words produced, with a higher number representing better verbal fluency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of Animal Naming Task scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Animal Naming Task, a verbal fluency task, measures the total number of animals named in one minute, with a higher number representing better verbal fluency

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of cognitive test scores (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Revised, Digit Span subtest, a number sequencing memory test, measures the number of correctly repeated sequences with maximum score of 48. The higher score represents better cognitive function

secondary_outcome.measure: Pooled standard deviation of serum phosphate levels (substudy)

intervention.description: Oral nicotinamide (500 mg) twice daily for at least 52 weeks
Matching placebo taken twice daily for at least 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age â‰¥ 18 years old
2. Kidney, liver, heart, or lung transplant at least two years ago
3. History of at least one prior histologically-confirmed keratinocyte carcinoma or squamous cell carcinoma in situ
4. Currently immunosuppressed with a calcineurin inhibitor-based regimen (cyclosporine or tacrolimus)
5. Able to attend follow-up visits
6. Able to speak and understand English (only for cognitive substudy)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Use of mTOR inhibitor (sirolimus, everolimus) within the past 12 weeks
2. Biopsy-confirmed acute rejection episode within the past 12 weeks
3. Active liver disease (elevated AST or ALT >3 times normal)
4. Severe renal failure (estimated glomerular filtration rate <20 mL/min/1.73 m2)
5. Current carbamazepine or primidone use
6. Pregnancy and lactation
7. Gorlin syndrome or other genetic skin cancer syndrome
8. Solid organ or hematologic malignancy, invasive Stage II melanoma, Merkel cell carcinoma, or metastatic skin cancer within the past five years, or invasive Stage I melanoma within the past two years
9. Untreated localized skin cancer (invasive squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma, or keratoacanthoma) at baseline (the patient can enrol after skin cancer treatment)
10. Use of nicotinamide or niacin within the past 12 weeks
11. Use of field therapy for actinic keratoses within the past 12 weeks
12. Initiation of systemic chemoprevention within the past 12 weeks

facility.name: Toronto General Hospital, University Health Network

patient_data.ipd_description: If feasibility thresholds are met, this pilot trial will proceed to a larger pivotal trial. The study protocol for the pivotal trial will be published prior to completion of data collection. Beyond 2 years after completion of the pivotal trial, the cleaned, anonymized, participant-level dataset and statistical code will made available for sharing with external researchers upon approval of a study proposal describing the intended data usage.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 2 years after completion of the pivotal trial that follows this pilot trial
